name: photovoltaic flat-roof installation, 3kWp, multi-Si, on roof | photovoltaic flat-roof installation, 3kWp, multi-Si, on roof | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/1644/documentation

This dataset represents a photovoltaic installation with a capacity of 3kWp and a lifetime of 30 years installed on an average location on the world. The installation consists out of the following infrastructure parts (represented by unit processes in the database):  ;- Panel: multi-Si (mc-Si)  ;-  flat roof mounting structure    ;- inverse rectifier ;- 3kWp electric installation ;;All four main unit processes include the material uses, emissions process energies and dismantling per unit.

This dataset starts from the purchase of the construction items needed for the mounting/installation of the 3kWp photovoltaic installation.

This activity ends with the mounting of the photovoltaic installation. 

This dataset includes all components for the installation of a 3kWp photovoltaic plant and the energy use for the mounting.

This dataset doesn't include dismantling as this is included in the infrastructure datasets.
category: C:Manufacturing/33:Repair and installation of machinery and equipment/332:Installation of industrial machinery and equipment/3320:Installation of industrial machinery and equipment

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Calculation of amount of panels used based on efficiency data for 2005. Other data are adopted.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Average installation for a global dataset. This dataset has been copied from an original dataset covering the geography Switzerland (CH). The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Current technology for mounting of panels or laminates, electric installations and other components. For technical details of the different installation components see in the particular infrastructure datasets. The construction process of flat-roof installations is the following way: The different parts of the mounting system are delivered to the construction site. Most of the mass is the gravel for the foundation. The gravel would also be necessary for flat roof without a PV plant. Insulating mats, aluminium profiles and smaller parts are the main parts of the mounting system. First;the flat roof is cleaned from sand and gravel. A mat made from recycled plastic is attached for the protection of the roof. Than a foundation is made and fixed with loose gravel placed on this plastic sheet. Aluminium profiles are mounted and the panels are fixed to this foundation.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Rough assumption for the decrease in material weights for mounting structures. This dataset has been copied from an original dataset covering the geography CH. The uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Publication for efficiency, mounting systems and own estimations for other components.

EcoSpold01Location=CH
Literature value, calculation. All parts have to be lifted to the roof with a crane. For single family houses this can be done with the crane attached to a truck. For higher buildings an extra crane must be used.

exchanges.description:
Calculated value. The lifetime of the inverter is assumed with 15 years. Thus, it must be exchanged once during the lifetime of the plant. The inverter investigated for this study has a capacity of 2.5 kW.
